Posts.Content: I no I’m terrible for it and I really don’t no why I bother because I’m still none the wiser.   I think only reason I wasn’t fobbed of is because of my family history.  Thank you so much for your reply.
Posts.Title: Lumps!

Posts.Content: Thank you so so much for your reply! It means so much, its such a scary time for us all, and as much as we are reassured constantly that it’s probably not cancerous it doesn’t ease our thoughts at all. I really hope your appointment goes ok would be great if you could let me no how it goes, mine is 25th June.  Dose your lump feel hard? Mine dose which is what I’m worried about but apparently the fact it  is slightly mobile means it’s a good thing! Please try not to feel to down, at any time you need to talk I’ll always be here. Funny enough I’m finding writing here a lot easier than talking to my husband. Talking to my husband / family members only seems to make them sad and worry that little bit more.  Really was lovely to hear from you! Xx
Posts.Title: Lumps!

Posts.Content: I really hope someone can give me some advice! I found a lump about three weeks ago now, I left it for two weeks and then went to see my Gp. My Gp said although it dose feel like it could possibly be a tumor she thinks it’s more than likely to be a cyst as it dose silighty move. I have to be honest to me it doesn’t feel like it moves at all it’s firm and oval shape. It’s in my right breast and it’s only slightly visible on the out side. It’s not painful but thing is I get pain in my left breast ( I no strange ) has anyone had this type of lump that has been Breast cancer?  My Mum had BC at the young age off 36 and My Dads Mum had it at 38. I’m 31 very nearly 32.  My Gp has urgently booked me in for a mammogram etc had appointment through and it’s nearly 3 weeks. I’m going nuts always trying to google BC and symptoms etc. Thank you!
Posts.Title: Lumps!
